Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Views

Class BallView

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Views.BallView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Movable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageBallView, RubberBallView
public abstract class BallView extends Object implements Movable
This is the abstract base class for all ball;s view and relates it to the movements of the ball.

The layout of the view of the ball binds with the model of the ball, every time the ball moves, the layout of the view of the ball will also be updated. By adding the view of the ball into container, the ball could be displayed onto the stage.

By extending the abstract class BallView, image ball and rubberBall could have their own way of showing.

Version:
Version2.0
update: Jan 3rd
Author:
Lin CHEN- modified

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      This function moves the ball by speed and updates the layout of ball's view.

      The center point of the ball will firstly be moved, and then the other four feature points and the layout of the view of the ball will be updated. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void move(){
      RectangularShape tmp = (RectangularShape) ballFace;
      center.setLocation((center.getX()+speedX),(center.getY()+speedY));
      double w = tmp.getWidth();
      double h = tmp.getHeight();

      tmp.setFrame((center.getX()-(w / 2)),(center.getY()-(h / 2)),w,h);
      setPoints(w,h);

      ballFace = tmp;
  }
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      See Also:
      • Movable.move()

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(javafx.geometry.Point2D p)
      This function moves the ball to specified position and updates the layout of ball's view.

      The center point of the ball will firstly be moved to the specified point, then the other four feature points of the ball and the layout of the view of the ball will be updated.

      It is used to recover ball's position when ball is lost. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void moveTo(Point p){
      center.setLocation(p);

      RectangularShape tmp = (RectangularShape) ballFace;
      double w = tmp.getWidth();
      double h = tmp.getHeight();

      tmp.setFrame((center.getX()-(w / 2)),(center.getY()-(h / 2)),w,h);
      ballFace = tmp;
  }
      Specified by:
      moveTo in interface Movable
      Parameters:
      p - the expected point of the ball center
      See Also:
      • Movable.moveTo(Point2D)

    • resetSpeed

      public void resetSpeed()
      This function resets the moving speed of ball.

      After resetting, the speed on x-axis will range from [-2,2] (excluding 0), and the speed on y-axis will range from [-2, 0). 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
         int speedX,speedY;
         do{
             speedX = rnd.nextInt(5) - 2;
         }while(speedX == 0);
         do{
             speedY = -rnd.nextInt(3);
         }while(speedY == 0);

         ball.setSpeed(speedX,speedY);
